item.title: Robinhood Q2 Crypto Business Revenue Reaches $160 Million, Slightly Below Expectations
item.description: On July 31st, according to Bloomberg, Robinhood Markets Inc. announced that its second-quarter revenue had exceeded the expectations of Wall Street, and this was due to the strong growth of its cryptocurrency trading business.In a press release on Wednesday, the company stated that the total net revenue for the quarter had increased by 45% year-on-year to $989 million, surpassing the average expectation of $9.215 billion surveyed by Bloomberg's analysts. The net profit also exceeded expectations, more than doubling to reach $386 million.The revenue related to cryptocurrency had increased by 98% to $160 million, which was slightly lower than the goal of achieving triple-digit growth for the sixth consecutive quarter. Analysts had previously expected the cryptocurrency revenue to be $162.1 million.In June of this year, Robinhood quickly attracted the attention of regulators in Europe after offering "tokenized" stocks to 150,000 customers in 30 countries, representing the company's

item.title: 「Fed's Microphone」: Powell Refuses Predetermined Rate Cut Path
item.description: On July 31st, "Fed's Whisperer" Nick Timiraos put up on social media that Fed Chair Powell has adopted a "tough defense stance" regarding whether to cut rates in September.When asked in a provocative manner "What would lead to a rate cut in September?", Powell replied, "I will not provide a specific answer. We need to observe the development of the data. There are multiple possibilities. We will make decisions based on comprehensive data analysis and a risk-balanced assessment."Just as the Potomac Research Group often states: If we are hungry, we will naturally eat.

item.title: Traders No Longer Fully Expect Fed to Cut Rates in October
item.description: On July 31st, traders lowered their anticipation for a multitude of rate cuts by the Federal Reserve this year. Traders no longer hold the full expectation that the Fed will cut rates in October. (FXStreet)

item.title: Bitcoin fell below $116,000 this morning before rebounding, now trading at $117,365.
item.description: On July 31st, based on HTX market data, Bitcoin dipped below $116,000 this morning and has now rebounded to $117,365, with a 24-hour decrease of 0.31%.

item.title: The probability of a Fed rate cut in September is 45.7%.
item.description: On July 31st, based on CME's "FedWatch" data, the likelihood of the Fed keeping interest rates unchanged in September is 54.3%, while the probability of a 25-basis-point rate cut is 45.7%.

item.title: Analyst: Fed's Future Rate Cuts Pose a Significant Communication Challenge
item.description: On July 31st, Tom Graff, the Chief Investment Officer of Facet Company, stated that the Federal Reserve is clearly in a rather delicate situation. Logically speaking, they had anticipated that the new tariffs would bring a certain level of inflation. Ideally, the Fed would prefer to wait until inflation reaches its peak before considering a rate cut. Nevertheless, the pressure is constantly building. Even if the White House is not applying external pressure, the recent weakness in the labor market is sufficient to cause concern for the Fed.In fact, this is likely the reason why Bullard and Bowman voted against maintaining the existing interest rate and advocated for a rate cut at this meeting. I believe that this decision has laid the groundwork for the Fed to initiate rate cuts at the September meeting and may implement 1 to 2 more rate cuts this year. The challenge lies in the fact that despite the potential for rising prices, the Fed still needs to cut rates. This will pose extrem

item.title: Analyst: Powell's Statement Leans Toward Hawkish Stance
item.description: On July 31st, analyst Chris Anstey declared that Powell mentioned, "There remains a great deal and a great deal of uncertainty to navigate through. Indeed, we are constantly obtaining more data. However, it seems to be a distance away at present, the conclusion of that process. I believe there will be a lot of developments out there." This assertion leans towards a hawkish stance.The Federal Reserve Chair Powell also pointed out that it is not feasible to make a decision six weeks from now based on the June forecasts (dot plot). In his personal view, we are in a moderately restrictive range, but there is a range of opinions on this matter. (FXStreet)

item.title: Economist: Federal Reserve's Statement Adjustment Surprisingly Reduces Uncertainty
item.description: On July 31st, Kathy Bostjancic, the Chief Economist at American Life Insurance Company, declared that surprisingly, the Fed removed the previous language regarding the reduction of uncertainty in the economic outlook from the policy statement and instead focused on the fact that uncertainty remains "still elevated."In our perspective, although uncertainty still exists, it has actually decreased significantly as the trade and tariff situation has become more clarified. (FX678)

item.title: Powell: Economy in a Solid Position, Inflation Rate Slightly Above Target
item.description: On July 31st, Federal Reserve Chair Powell declared that the economy is in a favorable state, with inflation being slightly higher than the target. The present policy stance has placed us in a beneficial position to respond promptly. The Fed remains committed to its dual mandate. (Xinhua News Agency)

item.title: Powell: Tariffs Have Boosted Some Prices
item.description: On July 31st, Federal Reserve Chair Powell stated that the year-on-year June core personal consumption expenditures (PCE) inflation rate might be 2.7%. Although inflation has moderated compared to 2022, it still remains at a relatively high level. The majority of long-term inflation expectations indicators are in line with the Fed's target.Tariffs have led to an increase in the prices of some goods. Whether inflation is transient or more persistent remains to be seen. (FX678)
